GARCIA

mysteriously;
What shall we become?
Vagabonds on the sea
Shivered by the hostile winds?
Not Tempest-tossed or becalmed
We shall trust in Cristobal Colon.
Reveal thy secret lands,
0 sea of paradise.
Give us the promised gold
sea of mercy.
The middle of the quiet night
Good night
Be on the watch ahead; may all go well.
Now I am truly alone,
Only now have I attained what I have
so ardently desired for so many yearsj
wandering from place to place, from king
to king, from man to man: I have reached
the void. Here I stand alone above the
Oceanic sea, who knows for how long, I
and the world alone, the world composed
of earth and sky, and the round sea..,.
Even my memories are fading... all is
far away: the scholars of Salamanca, the
mockery which followed me from street to
street on night in Cordova... all seems
far away. The stars above are shining,
waiting for the dawn... Nothing is there
but space and stars.. Space and stars.
We are sailing across the Oceanic sea.
May the words of Isaiah go with us:
From the uttermost part of the earth have
we heard songs, even glory to the righteous.
From the uttermost part of the earth
have we heard songs, even glory to the
